message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.PL, cs.RO, cs.SE 

This paper presents a novel solution for reducing node evaluations in heuristic planning based on machine learning. The paper focuses on learning search control for heuristic planning as a relational classification task, which involves capturing the preferred action to select in different planning contexts of a specific planning domain. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning), which are the primary areas of focus. Additionally, the paper also involves planning and decision-making, which are covered by sub-categories cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper also involves software engineering, as it presents two methods for guiding the search of a heuristic planner with the learned classifiers, which is covered by sub-category cs.SE (Software Engineering).
